entry.et: Middle English, from Latin addere, from ad- + -dere to put do

def.dt: :to join or unite so as to bring about an increase or improvement adds 60 acres to his land wine adds a creative touch to cooking
:to say further :append
:to combine (numbers) into an equivalent simple quantity or number
:to include as a member of a group don't forget to add me in
:to perform addition
:to come together or unite by addition
:to serve as an addition the movie will add to his fame
:to make an addition added to her savings
American Dialect Dictionary
attention deficit disorder
:being or able to be added to and enclosed within an existing system (as a computer) add–in hardware
:something added on: as
:a sum or amount added on
:something (as an accessory or added feature) that enhances the thing it is added to computer hardware add–ons
:being or able to be added on an add–on device
:able to be added to add–on certificates of deposit
:to come to the expected total the bill doesn't add up
:to form an intelligible pattern :make sense her story just doesn't add up
:amount 1b used with to the play adds up to a lot of laughs
:to amount to a lot just a little each time, but it all adds up
:to form an opinion of added him up at a glance
